before-stay.title: Before the stay
before-stay.p1: It is both cat owners and cat sitters responsibility to examine the cat(s) before the stay and agree on all the relevant matters, including but not limited to:
before-stay.list-item3: if the cat(s) are house trained,

owner.title: Some good advice for cat owner:
owner.list-item1: Prepare a small instruction for when and what food is expected to be served.
owner.list-item3: Be sure to leave information on how to contact you in an event of emergency.
owner.list-item4: Agree on pick-up/drop-off time that is suitable both for you and the sitter.

host.title: Do you have any poisonous plants? Discuss with the cat owner if those should be stored out of reach.
host.list-item1: Make sure you never leave windows or doors open wide enough for the cat to be able to escape.
host.list-item2: Do not let the cat outside or on the balcony.
host.list-item3: Harnessed catwalks are an option but discuss this with the owner first.
host.list-item4: Make sure that the cat owner is aware of any resident pets or young children in your home - some cats are sensitive like that.
host.list-item6: Feed the cat(s) according to owners instructions.
host.list-item7: Consult the veterinary professional immediatly if cat is sick, injured or showing any unusual behaviour.
host.list-item8: Update the owner regularly and be reachable, they worry :)
